meanings.definition: To fill with an excessive number of people or organisms.
meanings.sent1: The small island overpopulates quickly with tourists during the summer months.
meanings.sent2: The city overpopulates when many people move in search of better job opportunities.
meanings.sent3: The zoo overpopulates with penguins, making it look like a black and white parade.
meanings.sent4: The garden overpopulates with flowers, creating a colorful sea of petals.
meanings.sent5: The classroom overpopulates with students, causing desks to be crammed together tightly.

meanings.definition: To cause an area to become too densely populated.
meanings.sent1: The construction of new apartments overpopulates the neighborhood, leading to traffic congestion.
meanings.sent2: The rapid urbanization overpopulates rural areas, changing the landscape drastically.
meanings.sent3: The picnic overpopulates the park, turning it into a bustling outdoor cafeteria.
meanings.sent4: The storm overpopulates the sky with dark clouds, signaling an impending downpour.
meanings.sent5: The ant colony overpopulates the anthill, creating a bustling insect metropolis.
